entry.title: The Scottish Secure Tenancies (Proceedings for Possession) (Confirmation of Compliance with Pre-Action Requirements) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations prescribe the form in which a landlord must confirm to the court, before raising proceedings for possession in certain cases under section 14 of the Housing (Scotland) Act 2001, that the pre-action requirements in section 14A of that Act have been complied with. The cases are those where the proceedings are to include the ground that rent lawfully due from the tenant has not been paid (as set out in paragraph 1 of schedule 2 to the Act).

entry.title: The Guardian’s Allowance Up-rating (Northern Ireland) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order is made by the Treasury following a review of the general level of prices conducted under section 150 of the Social Security Administration Act 1992 (c. 5) in the tax year ending 5th April 2012.

entry.title: The Guardian’s Allowance Up-rating Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order is made by the Treasury following a review of the general level of prices conducted under section 150 of the Social Security Administration Act 1992 (c. 5) in the tax year ending 5th April 2012.

entry.title: The Social Security (Industrial Injuries) (Dependency) (Permitted Earnings Limits) Order (Northern Ireland) 2012
entry.summary: Paragraph 4 of Schedule 7 to the Social Security Contributions and Benefits (Northern Ireland) Act 1992 increases the weekly rate of a disablement pension, where the beneficiary is entitled to unemployability supplement, for periods during which the beneficiary is entitled to child benefit in respect of one or more children or qualifying young persons. Paragraph 4(4) applies where such a beneficiary is one of two persons who are spouses or civil partners residing together, or who are living together as husband and wife or civil partners, and the other person had earnings in any week. It provides that the increase shall not be payable in respect of the first child or qualifying young person if the other person’s earnings are £205 a week or more and in respect of further children or qualifying young persons for each complete £27 by which those earnings exceed £205. This Order increases the amounts of £205 and £27 to £215 and £28 respectively.

entry.title: The Scottish Public Services Ombudsman Act 2002 Amendment (No. 2) Order 2012

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Scottish Public Services Ombudsman Act 2002 Amendment (No. 2) Order 2012
The Scottish Public Services Ombudsman Act 2002 Amendment (No. 2) Order 2012

entry.summary: This Order amends Part2 of schedule2 to the Scottish Public Services Ombudsman Act 2002. Schedule2 to that Act specifies persons liable to investigation by the Scottish Public Services Ombudsman. The Order removes the General Teaching Council for Scotland from the list of persons specified for this purpose. This is in consequence of the amendments to the functions, constitution and governance arrangements of the General Teaching Council for Scotland made by the Public Services Reform (General Teaching Council for Scotland) Order 2011 ( S.S.I. 2011/215).

entry.title: The Social Security (Industrial Injuries) (Dependency) (Permitted Earnings Limits) Order 2012
entry.summary: Paragraph 4 of Schedule 7 to the Social Security Contributions and Benefits Act 1992 increases the weekly rate of a disablement pension, where the beneficiary is entitled to child benefit in respect of one or more children or qualifying young persons.

entry.title: The Social Security Benefits Up-rating Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations contain only provisions in consequence of an order under sections 132 and 132A of the Social Security Administration (Northern Ireland) Act 1992 and accordingly, by virtue of section 149(3) of, and paragraph 3 of Schedule 5 to, that Act, are not subject to the requirement of section 149(2) of that Act for prior reference to the Social Security Advisory Committee.

entry.title: The Identification and Traceability of Explosives (Amendment) (Northern Ireland) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Identification and Traceability of Explosives Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2010 (“the 2010 Regulations”), which implement, as regards Northern Ireland, Commission Directive 2008/43/EC setting up, pursuant to Council Directive 93/15/EC, a system for the identification and traceability of explosives for civil uses (“the 2008 Directive”).

entry.title: The Education (National Curriculum) (Key Stage 2 Assessment Arrangements) (England) (Amendment) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order amends the Education (National Curriculum) (Key Stage 2 Assessment Arrangements) (England) Order 2003 (“the 2003 Order”) to include provisions about a National Curriculum test (“NC test”) in English writing, which will be administered to pupils in accordance with article 5 of the 2003 Order (which relates to NC tests as defined in article 3(1) of that Order).

entry.title: The Workmen’s Compensation (Supplementation) (Amendment) Scheme 2012
entry.summary: This Scheme amends the Workmen’s Compensation (Supplementation) Scheme 1982 (S.I.1982/1489) by making adjustments to the rate of lesser incapacity allowance. This is consequential upon the increase in the maximum rate of that allowance made by the Social Security Benefits Up-rating Order 2012 (S.I.2012/780).

entry.title: The Housing (Scotland) Act 2010 (Commencement No. 7 and Transitional Provision) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order brings sections 153 and 155 of the Housing (Scotland) Act 2010 (“the 2010 Act”) into force on 1st August 2012, in so far as they are not already in force.

entry.title: The Tax Credits Up-rating Regulations 2012
entry.summary: Section 41 of the Tax Credits Act 2002 (c. 21) requires the Treasury, in each tax year, to—

entry.title: The Pensions (2008 No. 2 Act) (Commencement No. 7) Order (Northern Ireland) 2012
entry.summary: This Order brings into operation section 85 of, and Part 3 of Schedule 10 to, the Pensions (No. 2) Act (Northern Ireland) 2008 (“the Act”) on 6th April 2012. Those provisions provide for the removal of special provisions which apply to the protected rights of members of pension schemes on the contracting-out abolition date (defined in section 85(4) of the Act as the day appointed under section 21 of the Pensions Act (Northern Ireland) 2008 (c. 1 (N.I.)) for the coming into operation of section 13(1) of that Act).

entry.title: The Social Security Benefits Up-rating Regulations 2012
entry.summary: This instrument contains only provisions in consequence of an order under sections 150 and 150A of the Social Security Administration Act 1992 (c.5). Accordingly, by virtue of section 172(1) and (3) of, and paragraph 3 of Schedule 7 to, that Act, the Secretary of State has not referred these Regulations to the Social Security Advisory Committee.

entry.title: The Pensions (2008 Act) (Commencement No. 3) Order (Northern Ireland) 2012
entry.summary: This Order brings into operation section 13(1) of the Pensions Act (Northern Ireland) 2008 (“the Act”) on 6th April 2012, defined as the “abolition date” by section 13(2) of the Act. Section 13(1) abolishes contracting-out of the state additional pension for defined contribution pension schemes. Part 1 of Schedule 4 to the Act will also have effect from 6th April 2012 by virtue of section 13(4).

entry.title: The Scottish Secure Tenancies (Proceedings for Possession) (Form of Notice) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations prescribe the form of notice to be used by a landlord when notifying its tenant and any qualifying occupier under a Scottish secure tenancy, within the meaning of Part 2 of the Housing (Scotland) Act 2001 (“the Act”), that the landlord may raise possession proceedings in respect of the house which is the subject of the Scottish secure tenancy.

entry.title: The Town and Country Planning (Continuation in force of Local Plans) (Highland) (Scotland) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order continues in force certain provisions of the existing local plans for the Highland area notwithstanding the adoption of the Highland-wide Local Development Plan. The provisions of—

entry.title: The Consular Fees Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order revokes and replaces the Consular Fees Order 2011 as amended by the Consular Fees (Amendment) Order 2011.

entry.title: The European Union (Definition of Treaties) (Second Agreement amending the Cotonou Agreement) Order 2012

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The European Union (Definition of Treaties) (Second Agreement amending the Cotonou Agreement) Order 2011

entry.summary: This Order declares the Agreement amending for the second time the 2000 Partnership Agreement between the Members of the African, Caribbean and Pacific Group of States, of the one part, and the European Community and its Member States, of the other part (the Cotonou Agreement), signed in Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso on the 22nd of June 2010, to be an EU Treaty as defined in section 1(2) of the European Communities Act 1972.

entry.title: The Social Security (Suspension of Payment of Benefits and Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend various sets of social security regulations.
